bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton, September 30, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 17. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, September 30, 1892
Mr. William D. McCoy, to the Department of State.

Inclosure-- 1. Summary of Business. 2. Digest of Invoice Book. 3. Arrivals and Departures. 4. Record of Notarial Services. 5. Salary Account. 6. Contingent Expense Account. 7. Abstract of Contingent Expenses. 8. Register of Official Letters sent. 9. Record of Treasury Fees with Oath. 10. Vouchers for Expenditures.
No. 17. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, September 30, 1892.
Honorable William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, WASHINGTON, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor of submitting Inclosures numbered from 1 to 10 inclosure, the same being Reports for the Quarter ending this date.
I am, sir-- Your obedient servant,
William D. McCoy, U.S. Minister-Resident and Consul-General
Inclosures-- 1. Summary of Business. 2. Digest of Invoice Book. 3. Arrivals & Departure of American Vessels. 4. Record of Notarial Services. 5. Salary Account. 6. Contingent Expense Account.
7. Abstract of Contingent Expenses. 8. Register of Official Letters sent. 9. Record of Treasury Fee with Oath. 10. Vouchers for Expenditures.
